event.summary: 2/15/1993: Unknown perpetrators firebombed the offices of the Reproductive Services Clinic that was located within the Stonegate Professional Building in Corpus Christi, Texas, United States. There were no casualties, but the entire building was destroyed and nearby offices at a shopping mall were damaged as well. The total damages in the attack amounted to over $1,000,000.
event.motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Texas.
event.propcomment: Stonegate Professional Building was destroyed. Offices in adjacent strip mall were damaged.
event.addnotes: The attack took place at 12:31 AM. The abortion clinic had previously been the target of weekly picketers. The healthcare facility was never rebuilt.
event.scite1: "Women's Clinic Burns in Corpus Christi," Fort Worth Star-Telegram, February 15, 1993.
event.scite2: Larry Rohter, "Doctor Is Slain During Protest Over Abortions," New York Times, March 11, 1993.
event.scite3: Patricia Baird-Windle and Eleanor J. Bader, "Targets of Hatred: Anti-Abortion Terrorism," Palgrave, 2001.
